characteristics.description: Institutional characteristics for each school in a given year, including information like a school's name and address; available for years 1984-2023.

variables.id: Institutional unique identifier ID; though UNITIDs can vary over time due to instutions splitting, this variable is generally consistent for an institution over time.
variables.name: Name of institution location.
variables.webaddress: Admissions website URL of institution location.

admissions.description: Admissions data for each school in a given year (measured in the Fall), including information like ACT/SAT scores and acceptance rates by gender; available for years 2001-2023.

variables.id: Institutional unique identifier ID; though UNITIDs can vary over time due to instutions splitting, this variable is generally consistent for an institution over time.
variables.tot_applied: Total number of first-time, degree/certificate-seeking applicants in a given year.
variables.tot_admitted: Total number of first-time, degree/certificate-seeking applicants who were admitted in a given year.
variables.tot_enrolled: Total number of admitteees who ultimately enrolled (includes part-time and full-time enrollemnt).
variables.men_applied: Number of first-time, degree/certificate-seeking men who applied to an institution in a given year.
variables.men_admitted: Number of first-time, degree/certificate-seeking men who were admitted to an institution in a given year.
variables.men_enrolled: Number of admitted men who ultimately enrolled (includes part-time and full-time enrollemnt).
variables.yield_rate_men: Yield rate (share of admitted students who ultimately enrolled) of male admittees.
variables.yield_rate_women: Yield rate (share of admitted students who ultimately enrolled) of female admittees.
variables.men_applied_share: Male share of total number of first-time, degree/certificate-seeking applicants in a given year.
variables.men_admitted_share: Male share of total number of first-time, degree/certificate-seeking admittees in a given year.
variables.share_submit_sat: Share of admitted students who submitted an SAT score.
variables.share_submit_act: Share of admitted students who submitted an ACT score.

enrollment.description: Enrollment data for each school in a given year (measured in the Fall), including information like the male enrollment share and enrollment by gender and race; available at the undergraduate or graduate level; available for years 1984-2023.

variables.id: Institutional unique identifier ID; though UNITIDs can vary over time due to instutions splitting, this variable is generally consistent for an institution over time.
variables.studentlevel: Level of student enrollment; either 'undergrad' (Undergraduate) or 'grad' (Graduate).
variables.totmen: Total number of men enrolled in the Fall; this includes both part-time and full-time enrollment.
variables.totwomen: Total number of women enrolled in the Fall; this includes both part-time and full-time enrollment.
variables.wtmen: Total number of non-Hispanic White men enrolled in the Fall; this includes both part-time and full-time enrollment.
variables.wtwomen: Total number of non-Hispanic White women enrolled in the Fall; this includes both part-time and full-time enrollment.
variables.bkmen: Total number of non-Hispanic Black men enrolled in the Fall; this includes both part-time and full-time enrollment.
variables.bkwomen: Total number of non-Hispanic Black women enrolled in the Fall; this includes both part-time and full-time enrollment.
variables.hspmen: Total number of Hispanic men (of any race) enrolled in the Fall; this includes both part-time and full-time enrollment.
variables.hspwomen: Total number of Hispanic women (of any race) enrolled in the Fall; this includes both part-time and full-time enrollment.
variables.asnmen: Total number of non-Hispanic Asian men enrolled in the Fall; this includes both part-time and full-time enrollment.
variables.asnwomen: Total number of non-Hispanic Asian women enrolled in the Fall; this includes both part-time and full-time enrollment.
variables.totmen_share: Male share of total enrollment; 'total' here is defined as the sum of male and female enrollment; this includes both part-time and full-time enrollment.
variables.totwt_share: Non-Hispanic White share of total enrollment; 'total' here is defined as the sum of male and female enrollment; this includes both part-time and full-time enrollment.
variables.totbk_share: Non-Hispanic Black share of total enrollment; 'total' here is defined as the sum of male and female enrollment; this includes both part-time and full-time enrollment.
variables.tothsp_share: Hispanic share of total enrollment; 'total' here is defined as the sum of male and female enrollment; this includes both part-time and full-time enrollment.
variables.totasn_share: Non-Hispanic Asian share of total enrollment; 'total' here is defined as the sum of male and female enrollment; this includes both part-time and full-time enrollment.

completion.description: Completion data for each school in a given year by detailed subject field, including information like the male completion share within a subject (e.g., Economics); available at the Associate, Bachelor's, Master's or Doctoral level; available for years 1984-2023.

variables.id: Institutional unique identifier ID; though UNITIDs can vary over time due to instutions splitting, this variable is generally consistent for an institution over time.
variables.year: Survey year. Note that the cohort being tracked is the cohort that started either six years back (for bachelor) or three years back (for associate).
variables.cip: CIP (Classification of Instructional Programs) code for a subject in a given year.
variables.totmen: Total number of male completers within a CIP subject.
variables.totwomen: Total number of female completers within a CIP subject.
variables.wtmen: Total number of non-Hispanic White men completers within a CIP subject.; this includes both part-time and full-time enrollment.
variables.wtwomen: Total number of non-Hispanic White women completers within a CIP subject.; this includes both part-time and full-time enrollment.
variables.bkmen: Total number of non-Hispanic Black men completers within a CIP subject.; this includes both part-time and full-time enrollment.
variables.bkwomen: Total number of non-Hispanic Black women completers within a CIP subject.; this includes both part-time and full-time enrollment.
variables.hspmen: Total number of Hispanic men (of any race) completers within a CIP subject.; this includes both part-time and full-time enrollment.
variables.hspwomen: Total number of Hispanic women (of any race) completers within a CIP subject.; this includes both part-time and full-time enrollment.
variables.asnmen: Total number of non-Hispanic Asian men completers within a CIP subject.; this includes both part-time and full-time enrollment.
variables.asnwomen: Total number of non-Hispanic Asian women completers within a CIP subject.; this includes both part-time and full-time enrollment.
variables.totwt_share: Non-Hispanic White share of total (male and female) completers within a CIP subject.
variables.totbk_share: Non-Hispanic Black share of total (male and female) completers within a CIP subject.
variables.tothsp_share: Hispanic share of total (male and female) completers within a CIP subject.
variables.totasn_share: Non-Hispanic Asian share of total (male and female) completers within a CIP subject.
variables.totmen_share: Male share of total (male and female) completers within a CIP subject.
variables.deglevel: Degree level of completers; options include 'assc' (Associate's), 'bach' (Bachelor's), 'mast' (Master's), and 'doct' (Doctoral).

graduation.description: Graduation data for each school in a given year, including information like the graduation rate by gender and race; available at the Associate or Bachelor's level; available for years 2000-2023.

variables.id: Institutional unique identifier ID; though UNITIDs can vary over time due to instutions splitting, this variable is generally consistent for an institution over time.
variables.year: Survey year. Note that the cohort being tracked is the cohort that started either six years back (for bachelor) or three years back (for associate).
variables.deglevel: Level of student degree; either 'bach' (Bachelor's) or 'assc' (Associates).
variables.totmen: Total number of men within an adjusted cohort.
variables.totmen_graduated: Total number of men within an adjusted cohort that graduated within 150 percent of the normal time considered to graduate; for bachelor's degrees, this is six years, and for associate's degrees, this is three years.
variables.totwomen: Total number of women within an adjusted cohort.
variables.totwomen_graduated: Total number of women within an adjusted cohort that graduated within 150 percent of the normal time considered to graduate; for bachelor's degrees, this is six years, and for associate's degrees, this is three years.
variables.wtmen: Total number of non-Hispanic White men within an adjusted cohort.
variables.wtmen_graduated: Total number of non-Hispanic White men within an adjusted cohort that graduated within 150 percent of the normal time considered to graduate; for bachelor's degrees, this is six years, and for associate's degrees, this is three years.
variables.wtwomen: Total number of non-Hispanic White women within an adjusted cohort.
variables.wtwomen_graduated: Total number of  non-Hispanic White women within an adjusted cohort that graduated within 150 percent of the normal time considered to graduate; for bachelor's degrees, this is six years, and for associate's degrees, this is three years.
variables.bkmen: Total number of non-Hispanic Black men within an adjusted cohort.
variables.bkmen_graduated: Total number of non-Hispanic Black men within an adjusted cohort that graduated within 150 percent of the normal time considered to graduate; for bachelor's degrees, this is six years, and for associate's degrees, this is three years.
variables.bkwomen: Total number of non-Hispanic Black women within an adjusted cohort.
variables.bkwomen_graduated: Total number of non-Hispanic Black women within an adjusted cohort that graduated within 150 percent of the normal time considered to graduate; for bachelor's degrees, this is six years, and for associate's degrees, this is three years.
variables.hspmen: Total number of Hispanic men within an adjusted cohort.
variables.hspmen_graduated: Total number of Hispanic men within an adjusted cohort that graduated within 150 percent of the normal time considered to graduate; for bachelor's degrees, this is six years, and for associate's degrees, this is three years.
variables.hspwomen: Total number of Hispanic women within an adjusted cohort.
variables.hspwomen_graduated: Total number of Hispanic women within an adjusted cohort that graduated within 150 percent of the normal time considered to graduate; for bachelor's degrees, this is six years, and for associate's degrees, this is three years.
variables.asnmen: Total number of non-Hispanic Asian men within an adjusted cohort.
variables.asnmen_graduated: Total number of non-Hispanic Asian men within an adjusted cohort that graduated within 150 percent of the normal time considered to graduate; for bachelor's degrees, this is six years, and for associate's degrees, this is three years.
variables.asnwomen: Total number of non-Hispanic Asian women within an adjusted cohort.
variables.asnwomen_graduated: Total number of non-Hispanic Asian women within an adjusted cohort that graduated within 150 percent of the normal time considered to graduate; for bachelor's degrees, this is six years, and for associate's degrees, this is three years.
variables.gradrate_totmen: Graduation rate for men (within 150 percent of normal time taken to graduate).
variables.gradrate_totwomen: Graduation rate for women (within 150 percent of normal time taken to graduate).
variables.gradrate_wtmen: Graduation rate for non-Hispanic White men (within 150 percent of normal time taken to graduate).
variables.gradrate_wtwomen: Graduation rate for non-Hispanic White women (within 150 percent of normal time taken to graduate).
variables.gradrate_bkmen: Graduation rate for non-Hispanic Black men (within 150 percent of normal time taken to graduate).
variables.gradrate_bkwomen: Graduation rate for non-Hispanic Black women (within 150 percent of normal time taken to graduate).
variables.gradrate_hspmen: Graduation rate for Hispanic men (within 150 percent of normal time taken to graduate).
variables.gradrate_hspwomen: Graduation rate for Hispanic women (within 150 percent of normal time taken to graduate).
variables.gradrate_asnmen: Graduation rate for  non-Hispanic Asianmen (within 150 percent of normal time taken to graduate).
variables.gradrate_asnwomen: Graduation rate for non-Hispanic Asian women (within 150 percent of normal time taken to graduate).

cip.description: Provides subject field codes for subjects in a given year; should be used with Completion data; available for years 1984-2023.

variables.year: Survey year. Note that the cohort being tracked is the cohort that started either six years back (for bachelor) or three years back (for associate).
variables.cip: CIP (Classification of Instructional Programs) identifier code.
